content:
User: Ok, I have to restart git bash, can you start with all commands I need to run, in order, with expected result when starting a new git bash session in the root directory. Just that, no long explanations and I'll let you know if I have issues. All text in main chat window except code in executable copy/paste code blocks. Let's get through this together! Help me.

Gemini: Set Terraform PATH for Git Bash:

export PATH="$PATH:/c/terraform"
Expected Result: No error message. Command completes silently.

Verify Terraform in Git Bash:

terraform --version
Expected Result: Output showing Terraform version information. NO "terraform: not found" error.

Terraform v...
... (version details) ...
Set gcloud Python PATH for Git Bash:

export PATH="$PATH:/c/Program Files (x86)/Google/Cloud SDK/google-cloud-sdk/platform/bundledpython"
(Important: If your Python directory is different, use your correct path here.) Expected Result: No error message. Command completes silently.

Verify gcloud in Git Bash:

gcloud --version
Expected Result: Output showing Google Cloud SDK version information. NO "python: not found" error and NO "'gcloud' is not recognized" error.

Google Cloud SDK ...
... (version details) ...
Run the deployment script:

bash deploy.sh
Expected Result: The deploy.sh script should start executing. You should see output starting with:

[STEP] Checking prerequisites...
Let the script run and observe the output for further steps and potential errors.

After running each command, check for the "Expected Result" before moving to the next command.

Let me know after you've run these commands and what the output is! We're on this! 💪

Logo for Gemini Apps
Gemini Apps
